settings.text: Merino wool is odour resistant and breathable as well as wrinkle resistant and antibacterial, just a few reasons why we love it.

settings.title: Our Guide To Caring For Wool

settings.text:
To best remove stains, immediately spot clean with cold water from the backside of the fabric, pushing the stain outwards instead of further into the fibres. Do not rub or scrub the material, as that causes damage to the fibres.

Make sure that you fold and do not hang knitwear to avoid misshaping.

If possible, always opt for airing your Merino Wool garments, you can easily do so by placing the garment where there is free flowing air. This is the preferred method for many fabrics to ensure longevity and quality maintenance.

If you need, wash Merino Wool in the machine at a low temperature on a gentle machine cycle, using a mild detergent without bleach.

Air dry - it is kinder to both the product and the environment, make sure to shape your knitwear before drying. Do not tumble dry as Merino Wool will shrink when exposed to higher heat.

Due to the nature of the Merino Wool you should not need to iron but if you wish use a cool iron avoiding embroidery.

Curious on care instructions for a specific product? You can always find care instructions on the inner tag of your garments.
